p: A disturbed host balance due to the altered composition of biofilm is a known cause of initiation of dental diseases, i.e., dental caries and periodontal diseases. Both dental caries and periodontal diseases have a different etiology which involves bacteria described as metabolic and geographic opposites. The most common site of dental caries is supragingivally whereas periodontal diseases are seen sub gingivally attacking the tooth supporting structures. Dynamics of microbiota causing these diseases may also affect the treatment of either.[ 2]
